climbs.name: Seesaw
climbs.fa: Mark Mellott, Adrain Montano, Chris Grayson 2021

content.description: A little variation to Sawtooth for those who can't get enough slab mantles in their life. Start on Sawtooth and once you encounter the good plate midway up, work slightly right onto the good horizontal rail. Use some slab trickery and you'll find yourself standing on the rail with the jug lip within reach. She could use a little scrub, but is still climbable with that lichen top coat.

This may be my favorite highball in the Coco. Start on head height crimps moveing up left to a good rail.  Trend up and left to crimps and do a dynamic lunge to a good rail. From the rail move right to a small but postive crimp, then do a dooky shooting move to a pinch loaf. Match the loaf wrapping the top and traverse right to grab the V at the top of the wall.
content.location: Starts on the small crimps at chest height

content.description: Start on head height crimps moveing up left to a good rail.  Trend right doing balancy moves on side pulls to a good rail. From the rail move right to a small but postive crimp, then do a dooky shooting move to a pinch loaf. Match the loaf wrapping the top and traverse right to grab the V at the top of the wall.
content.location: To the left of Jig Saw, Start on the terrible crimps at head height.

content.description: Wonderfull feature, dowsed in Lichen. Stand start on the pedastal moving up into the layback and to the suspect the jug to the right. Do some crazy knee bars to grovel into handjams in the crack. Move up into more hand jams, and into the crux. Jams get much easier once your feet are above the suddle lip, and mantling the lip is easy if you did the rest.
content.location: Start feet on the sloping pedastal and squeeze it or start laybacking the crack.

content.description: Large boulder covered in beautiful highballs developed as TR's in the 90's.
